intro: Salsola divaricata, commonly known as Russian thistle or goatweed, is a species of flowering plant in the family Amaranthaceae. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. The plant has spiny leaves and produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense heads. It is well adapted to harsh conditions, with a deep root system that allows it to survive in drought-prone areas. Salsola divaricata is also known for its rapid growth and ability to spread aggressively, making it a common invasive species in many regions.
